page.title: 03INTERVIEW: DOUNBY TEACHER
page.content: Mrs.Esson is a teacher at{Dounby {Primary School.}She has been teaching since 1966, her first school being Cuminestown near Turriff where she taught for two years. She then came back to Orkney and taught at Papdale Primary in Kirkwall for two and a half years before moving to the old Dounby School. The old school had two buildings with two rooms each. They were called Horsa Huts (wartime buildings) and housed 70 to 80 pupils. She has worked at the new school since it opened in 1976. The new school is bigger, modern, has carpets, a lot more equipment and also far more pupils. It also has many more visiting teachers. In the next 20 years she sees teaching becoming more "Computerised" but hopes there will still be a place for books, jotters and pencils.
